FuncDef:
The isis peer-ip-ignore command prevents IS-IS from checking the IP address of each received Hello packet.
The undo isis peer-ip-ignore command cancels the configuration.
By default, IS-IS checks the IP address of each received Hello packet.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In most cases, IS-IS checks the IP address of each received Hello packet. The neighbor relationship can be established only when the IP address carried in the Hello packet and the address of the interface that receives the Hello packet belong to the same network segment. If the IP addresses of the two interfaces belong to different network segments, and the isis peer-ip-ignore command is run on the two interfaces, IS-IS does not check the peer IP address. Then, the neighbor relationship can be established on the two IS-IS interfaces. There are routes to the two different network segments in the routing table, but the IP addresses of the two interfaces on the link cannot be pinged from each other.
The isis peer-ip-ignore command is valid on P2P interfaces, including NBMA interfaces and the interfaces whose network type is set to P2P using the isis circuit-type p2p command. The isis peer-ip-ignore command takes effect only when it is run on the two ends of a link.
On a broadcast interface, you need to run the isis circuit-type p2p command in the interface view before running the isis peer-ip-ignore command. The isis circuit-type p2p command takes effect only on broadcast interfaces.On a P2P interface or an NBMA interface, you can run the isis peer-ip-ignore command without having to run the isis circuit-type p2p command first.
